intro: Dacryodes igaganga, commonly known as the African snowbell, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Burseraceae, which includes frankincense and myrrh trees. The plant is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and simple, alternate leaves that are elliptical in shape. Its flowers are small, greenish-white, and clustered in umbels, while the fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, winged seeds. The plant is often found in secondary forests and along riverbanks, contributing to local biodiversity.
